Click on each apparatus/reagents to know its name or click on “Continue” to start the experiment.
Take a mouse from its cage.
Put it in a Carbon Dioxide chamber.
Close the chamber.
Turn on the tap of the Carbon Dioxide supply.
Within 30 seconds, we can observe that mouse will be unconscious. Animal should be left in the container for several minutes (2minutes) to ensure death.
Open the chamber and take out the dead mouse.
Pin the euthanized mouse on its back on dissection board as shown.
Take out the alcohol pad.
Rub it over the exposed part of mouse.
Take a scalpel.
Make a midline incision with the scalpel as shown.
Take an iris scissor.
Bisect the incised portion using an iris scissor.
Pin the opened skin down on the board as shown.
From the top exposed portion, use the scalpel and cut gently downwards in a straight line.
Use curved iris forceps, hold the spleen with and cut out the base of the spleen.
Place the spleen in several milliliters of Complete DMEM medium in a tissue culture plate.
Make an incision in the chest, beginning at the xiphoid and extending to the neck with scalpel.
Grasp each lobe of the thymus with curved forceps and gently pull the thymus away, cut at the basal portion using iris scissors.
Place the thymus tissue in several milliliters of Complete DMEM media in a tissue culture plate.
